Manchester United.passage: Manchester United Football Club is a professional football club based in Old Trafford, Greater Manchester, England, that competes in the Premier League, the top flight of English football. Nicknamed the Red Devils, the club was founded as Newton Heath LYR Football Club in 1878, changed its name to Manchester United in 1902 and moved to its current stadium in 1910. Manchester United has won a record 20 league titles, 12 FA Cups, 5 League Cups and a record 3 UEFA Champions League titles. The club has a long-standing rivalry with Liverpool, and has a large following of fans worldwide. The club's home colours are a red shirt with a white trim, white shorts and red socks. The club's badge features the club's name inside the traditional roundel, which is a stylised representation of the city of Manchester's coat of arms, which features a ship on its river, representing the Manchester Ship Canal. Manchester United is one of the most valuable sports teams in the world, worth an estimated $3.69 billion, and is ranked as the world's most valuable football brand by Forbes. The club's revenue in 2020-21 was £628.3 million, the highest in the world, and the club has a large global following, with over 659 million fans worldwide. The club has a long history of successful players, including George Best, Denis Law, Bobby Charlton, Ryan Giggs, David Beckham, and Wayne Rooney. The current manager is Ole Gunnar Solskjær, who took over from José Mourinho in December 2018.

New England Patriots.passage: The New England Patriots are a professional American football team based in the Greater Boston region. The Patriots play their home games at Gillette Stadium in the town of Foxborough, Massachusetts, which is located 21 miles (34 km) southwest of downtown Boston and 20 miles (32 km) northeast of downtown Providence, Rhode Island. The Patriots are part of the East Division of the American Football Conference (AFC) in the National Football League (NFL). The team was founded in 1960 as the Boston Patriots, one of the eight teams that joined the American Football League (AFL) in its inaugural season. The team changed its name to the New England Patriots in 1971, and has since become one of the most successful franchises in NFL history. The Patriots have appeared in 11 Super Bowls, winning six of them, the most of any team in NFL history. They have also won 14 division championships, 17 conference championships, and have the second-best overall record in the NFL since 1970. The Patriots have a storied history of successful coaches and players. Bill Belichick has been the head coach of the team since 2000, and has led the team to six Super Bowl victories. Tom Brady has been the starting quarterback for the team since 2001, and has won six Super Bowl MVP awards. Other notable players in the team's history include quarterbacks Jim Plunkett and Drew Bledsoe, running backs Curtis Martin and Corey Dillon, and wide receivers Randy Moss and Rob Gronkowski.

Real Madrid.passage: Real Madrid Club de Fútbol, commonly known as Real Madrid, is a professional football club based in Madrid, Spain. Barcelona.passage: Barcelona is the capital and largest city of the autonomous community of Catalonia in Spain, as well as the second most populous municipality of Spain. It is located on the Mediterranean coast between the mouths of the rivers Llobregat and Besòs, and is bounded to the west by the Serra de Collserola mountain range, to the south by the Mediterranean Sea and to the north by the autonomous communities of Aragon and Navarra. As of 2021, Barcelona has a population of 1.6 million people within its administrative limits, and a metropolitan area of over 3.2 million people, making it the sixth-most populous urban area in the European Union after Paris, London, Ruhr area, Madrid and Milan. It is the tenth-most populous city in the European Union and the largest city on the Mediterranean Sea. Barcelona is one of the world's leading tourist, economic, and cultural centers, and its influence in commerce, education, fashion, entertainment, sports, and the arts all contribute to its status as one of the world's major global cities. It is a major cultural and tourist destination and its importance in commerce, education, fashion, entertainment, sports, and the arts all contribute to its status as one of the world's major global cities. The city is famous for its architecture, including works by Antoni Gaudí and Lluís Domènech i Montaner, which have been declared UNESCO World Heritage Sites. The city has a rich cultural heritage and is today an important cultural center, with a rich and diverse cultural life. It is also a major tourist destination, attracting millions of visitors every year.

Boston Celtics.passage: The Boston Celtics are a professional basketball team based in Boston, Massachusetts. They play in the National Basketball Association (NBA), as a member of the league's Eastern Conference Atlantic Division. Founded in 1946, the team is owned by Boston Basketball Partners LLC. The Celtics play their home games at the TD Garden, which they share with the National Hockey League (NHL)'s Boston Bruins. The Celtics have won a total of 17 NBA championships, which is the most of any franchise in NBA history, and have won 21 division titles. The Celtics have also had long-standing rivalries with the New York Knicks and the Philadelphia 76ers. Bayern Munich.passage: Bayern Munich is a German sports club based in Munich, Bavaria, Germany. It is best known for its professional football team, which plays in the Bundesliga, the top tier of the German football league system, and is the most successful club in German football history, having won 29 national titles and 6 European titles. The club was founded in 1900 by 11 football players, led by Franz John, as the Munich Football Club. The club changed its name to Bayern Munich in 1906 in honor of the ruling house of Bavaria, and has since grown to include a wide range of sports and athletic programs, including basketball, handball, and ice hockey. Bayern Munich has a fierce rivalry with 1860 Munich, another Munich-based football club. The two clubs have played each other over 90 times in competitive matches, with Bayern Munich holding the upper hand in recent years. The club's home ground is the Allianz Arena, which it shares with local rivals TSV 1860 Munich. The stadium has a capacity of 75,000 and is known for its iconic exterior, which features a translucent exterior that changes color at night. Bayern Munich has a large and passionate fan base, with supporters known as the Bayern Munich Fanclub. The club has a global following, with fans in over 180 countries around the world. Bayern Munich has a long history of success in European football, having won 6 European titles, including 5 UEFA Champions League titles. The club has also won 29 national titles, including 7 Bundesliga titles in a row from 2013 to 2019.

Chicago Cubs.passage: The Chicago Cubs are a professional baseball team based in Chicago, Illinois. They play in the National League Central division of Major League Baseball (MLB). The Cubs are one of two remaining charter members of the National League, which was founded in 1876. Along with the Tampa Bay Rays, the Cubs are one of two Major League clubs based in cities that have not had a team in the other major North American professional sports leagues. The Cubs play their home games at Wrigley Field, located on the North Side of Chicago. Wrigley Field is the oldest ballpark in the major leagues and is known for its iconic ivy-covered outfield walls and its historic status as a Chicago landmark. The Cubs have a storied history, with a total of 11 World Series championships, second only to the New York Yankees. The team has a strong fan base, known as "Cub Nation," which has supported the team through its ups and downs over the years. The Cubs have had many famous players over the years, including Hall of Famers such as Ernie Banks, Billy Williams, and Ron Santo. More recently, the team has featured stars such as Sammy Sosa, Mark Prior, and Kerry Wood. The Cubs have also had several successful managers, including legendary skipper Joe McCarthy and current manager Joe Maddon. Despite their success, the Cubs have also experienced a long period of futility, particularly in the second half of the 20th century. The team went over 100 years without winning a World Series before finally breaking through in 2016, ending a drought that was one of the longest in sports history.

qae_pairs.explanation: The Cubs have had many famous players over the years, including Hall of Famers such as Ernie Banks, Billy Williams, and Ron Santo.

qae_pairs.question: What is the location of Wrigley Field, the home stadium of the Chicago Cubs?
qae_pairs.explanation: The Cubs play their home games at Wrigley Field, located on the North Side of Chicago.

The league is divided into two conferences: the Eastern Conference and the Western Conference, each of which has three divisions: the Atlantic, Metropolitan, and Central; and the Pacific, Central, and Pacific. Wilt Chamberlain.passage: Wilt Chamberlain (August 21, 1936 – October 12, 1999) was an American professional basketball player who played for the Philadelphia Warriors and the Philadelphia 76ers of the National Basketball Association (NBA). He played for the University of Kansas Jayhawks before being drafted by the Warriors with the first overall pick in the 1959 NBA draft. Chamberlain is widely considered one of the greatest basketball players of all time. He stood 7 feet 1 inch (2.16 m) tall and weighed 250 pounds (113 kg) during his playing career, and was known for his versatile offensive style, his rebounding and shot-blocking abilities, and his dominant defense. Chamberlain holds numerous records in the NBA, including the most points scored in a single game (100) and the most rebounds in a single game (55). He is the only player in NBA history to average more than 30 points and 20 rebounds per game in a season, a feat he accomplished seven times. Chamberlain won two NBA championships, four MVP awards, and was a 13-time All-Star. He was also a member of the United States men's national basketball team that won the gold medal at the 1960 Summer Olympics. Chamberlain was known for his flamboyant personality and his penchant for breaking down racial barriers in the sport. He was also a successful businessman and investor after his retirement from basketball. Chamberlain died of heart failure in 1999 at the age of 63.

qae_pairs.question: What team did Wilt Chamberlain play for in the NBA before being drafted by the Philadelphia 76ers?
qae_pairs.explanation: Wilt Chamberlain played for the Philadelphia Warriors before being drafted by the Philadelphia 76ers in the NBA.

qae_pairs.explanation: Passage: He played for the University of Kansas Jayhawks before being drafted by the Warriors with the first overall pick in the 1959 NBA draft.

the National Basketball Association.passage: The National Basketball Association (NBA) is a men's professional basketball league in North America, composed of 30 teams. It is widely considered to be the premier men's professional basketball league in the world, and is one of the four major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada. The NBA's 82-game regular season runs from October to April, with playoffs and the NBA Finals usually held in June. The league was founded in 1946 as the Basketball Association of America (BAA), and merged with the National Basketball League (NBL) in 1949 to become the NBA. The league's headquarters are located in New York City, with teams distributed across the United States and Canada. The NBA has featured many famous players over the years, including Michael Jordan, LeBron James, Kobe Bryant, and Shaquille O'Neal. The league has also been marked by controversies, such as the 2007 NBA referee scandal, in which several referees were accused of betting on games. Despite this, the NBA remains one of the most popular and successful sports leagues in the world.

the Pacific Division.passage: The Pacific Division is one of the four divisions in the National Hockey League's (NHL) Western Conference. It was created in 1993 as part of the league's realignment into six divisions. The division is made up of five teams: the Anaheim Ducks, the Calgary Flames, the Edmonton Oilers, the Los Angeles Kings, and the San Jose Sharks. The Pacific Division is known for its high level of competition and has produced several Stanley Cup champions over the years. The division has also been home to some of the NHL's most iconic players, including Wayne Gretzky, Mario Lemieux, and Jaromir Jagr. the Los Angeles Kings.passage: The Los Angeles Kings are a professional ice hockey team based in Los Angeles, California. They were founded in 1967 and are members of the Pacific Division of the Western Conference in the National Hockey League (NHL). The team has won two Stanley Cup championships, in 2012 and 2014. The Kings have played their home games at the Staples Center since 1999. The team has a strong fan base, known as the "Kings Army". The team's colors are black, silver, and white. Lluís Domènech.passage: Lluís Domènech i Montaner (1850-1923) was a Catalan architect, designer, and politician, best known for his work in the Catalan Modernista style. He was born in Barcelona and studied at the Escola Tècnica Superior d'Arquitectura de Barcelona, where he later taught. He was a member of the Catalan Regionalist movement and served as the mayor of Barcelona from 1906 to 1907. Domènech's most famous works include the Palau de la Música Catalana, a concert hall in Barcelona, and the Hospital de Sant Pau, a large complex of buildings in the same city. He also designed several houses and other buildings in the Modernista style, which was characterized by its ornate decoration and use of new materials such as steel and glass. Domènech was a prolific writer and speaker, and he played an important role in the cultural and political life of Catalonia. He was a member of the Catalan Regionalist Union and was involved in the organization of the 1908 Universal Exposition in Barcelona, which showcased the region's culture and industry. He was also a member of the Spanish Parliament and worked to promote Catalan autonomy. Domènech's work had a significant influence on the development of Modernisme and on the architecture of the early 20th century. He was awarded the Creu de Sant Jordi in 1982, the highest honor of the Generalitat de Catalunya, and his legacy is celebrated in museums and exhibitions throughout Catalonia.
